text: William Black (5 September 1882 – 7 February 1960) was a Scottish footballer who played for Queen's Park, Celtic (winning the Scottish Football League title in his sole season with the club, 1904–05, but suffering a bad injury),(Celtic player) Black, William, FitbaStats EvertonWilliam Black, 11v11.com Dumbarton, Kilmarnock, Hamilton AcademicalBlack, Willie (1909), Hamilton Academical Memory Bank and Airdrieonians. He was born on the Isle of Mull but spent most of his life living in Motherwell.William Black, A Blue From The Hebrides, Tony Onslow, EFC Heritage, 28 September 2018 ==Notes and references== Category:1882 births Category:1960 deaths Category:Scottish footballers Category:People from the Isle of Mull Category:Sportspeople from Motherwell Category:Queen's Park F.C. players Category:Celtic F.C. players Category:Everton F.C. players Category:Dumbarton F.C. players Category:Airdrieonians F.C. title: William Black (footballer)
